name: "The Flash" 3.13 "Attack on Gorilla City" Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What continent is Gorilla City located on?
questions.explanation:
Africa.

	Gorilla City was the home to a race of sentient gorillas. Early in the episode Jesse Quick came through a portal from Earth-2 to tell the team that her dad (Harrison Wells of Earth-2) had gone to Gorilla City two weeks earlier.

questions.text: Which member of the Earth-prime team didn't go through the portal to Earth-2?
questions.explanation:
Wally.

	Wally stayed behind with Jesse Quick in case there were any attacks on Central City. Julian insisted on going with the team as well, just for the chance to travel to another dimension. Barry and Julian used the excuse that they were going to a conference to cover for themselves at work.

questions.text: Jesse confused HW with her father when she first arrived on the prime Earth.
questions.explanation:
True.

	When HW walked into the room she yelled "dad" and ran to him to hug him. After he made a joke about that being how to welcome something the team told her that it was a different Earth's version of Harrison Wells, not her father.

Telepathically.

	Grodd, or Gorilla Grodd as he was known in the comics, is a giant gorilla who has superior intelligence than most beings. He can communicate telepathically to both humans and animals. In a previous seaons Flash had banished him to Earth-2.

questions.text: What punishment did Barry and his friends get for entering Gorilla City?
options: A beating before being expelled from the city.
questions.explanation:
Death by combat.

	Grodd tricked them into coming to the city to look for Harrison Wells so that they would be captured and forced to battle the leader of the gorillas in combat. Grodd's plan was that either Flash would die, or he would kill the lead gorilla and Grodd could take over. All fights in the arena were supposed to be to the death. Barry fought the giant white-haired gorilla for a few seconds before he realized that he couldn't go head to head. He was injured while trying to generate a lighting bolt to throw, but eventually knocked out the gorilla before showing him mercy and letting him live.

questions.text: What movie and television character did Julian get compared to twice?
questions.explanation:
Indiana Jones.

	Both on Earth-1 and Earth-2 Julian was mentioned as being "Indiana". First a specific joke about his outfit asking if her was Indiana Jones, and then on Earth-2 while they were locked in cages Harrison woke up and called him Indiana.  Indiana Jones was a character in at least 4 movies and a television series prior to the airing of this episode.

questions.text: Did Jesse agree to stay with Wally when he first asked her to?
questions.explanation:
No.

	No, she quickly said no, and gave him several reasons. One of the reasons was that once he got his powers (Which she didn't know about prior to coming back to Earth-1) he stopped contacting her. Later in the episode she was found by HW sitting and thinking about staying with Wally on Earth-1. Just before the credits rolled Jesse told Wally that she wanted to stay after all.

Barry.

	They used Caitlin's cold powers to freeze his body and trick Grodd into thinking he died. Once Grodd tossed his body on a pile of bones outside of the cage and walked out he woke up and freed his companions.

questions.text: Did the team return home to Earth-1 before the episode ended?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	They came back thanks to Cisco opening a breech. After Harrison and Jesse were reunited the two Harrison's had a quick chat and the team told the rest of the crew a brief version of what happened on Earth-2.

questions.text: Who was stuck in the medical bay at Star Labs near the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Harrison.

	After his several week imprisonment in Gorilla City he was forced to seek medical treatment once he returned to Earth-1. He was given a good prognosis, just needed food, and rest to return to normal.
